reviewText: Very happy with the dvd. Received it quickly and in great condition.So excited to be able to view these movies when I want. Love the movies!

Title: Santa Who? / A Chance of Snow

reviewText: Santa Who is good comedy entertainment and Chance of Snow is drama.  Any Leslie Nielsen comedy is guaranteed to make one laugh.  This fact make the purchase worth the price by itself.  On the other hand, Chance of Snow tugs at the heart somewhat while making one laugh at the same time.  The divorced couple snowed in at the same airport is a good premise and the film is good family entertainment.  For the price I recommend this selection.
Title: Santa Who? / A Chance of Snow

reviewText: Maybe they are not destined to become classics, but they are both quite enjoyable, if you're looking for Christmas themed entertainment.
Title: Santa Who? / A Chance of Snow

reviewText: A nice double feature with some comedy and heart for Christmas.  They are shown from time to time around the holiday season but I recommend buying this through Amazon to add to your library.CA Luster
summary: Santa Who? / A Chance of Snow (Double Feature)
Title: Santa Who? / A Chance of Snow

reviewText: I had somehow missed these when they were new. I really hoped I wasn't wasting my money, but it was money well spent. My husband likes them as much as I do. We both love watching holiday movies (he's more picky), and since we gave up the high cost of cable etc. six years ago I am always watching for low prices to increase my video collection. "Santa Who" is great for the whole family because it shows young children that there really is a Santa. (Give them a chance to be kids!)"A Chance of Snow" is also a good family movie, just not aimed at the little ones.I recommend the both for an enjoyable family movie night!
Title: Santa Who? / A Chance of Snow

reviewText: I haven't seen this one yet but plan on watching this weekend but I'm sure it's a good one we will see.
Title: Santa Who? / A Chance of Snow

reviewText: Both very good movies and both movies displaying a need for believing. I enjoyed both movies. I don't always buy double features as I prefer to file my movies alphabetically
Title: Santa Who? / A Chance of Snow

reviewText: Who doesn't like Leslie Nielson?  "Santa Who" was adorable with the real Santa falling on his head and having anemsia really close to Christmas.  All the characters are entertaining and the little boy upstages the adults sometimes and he KNOWS Nielson is the real Santa and keeps trying to tell the adults who don't listen - the lesson to be learned.  Good movie, we will watch it again next year.  "Chance of Snow" was also good - a family on the brink of divorce ends up stranded at the airport and with the help of Charles Durning and his "wife" help the younger parents realize they must forgive each other.The combination of movies is so worth the price.
Title: Santa Who? / A Chance of Snow

reviewText: This is a funny movie with a good ending.  Good for the whole family. I would recomend this movie highly.
Title: Santa Who? / A Chance of Snow

reviewText: Ordered this for my hubby who loves Christmas movies!  Leslie Neilson is charming in Santa Who!  A Chance of Snow is a sweet holiday tale.  Great additions to our movie library.
summary: A Chance of Snow is a sweet holiday tale
Title: Santa Who? / A Chance of Snow

reviewText: For the price, this was a great purchase. Although the movies are different, they both have the feel good Christmas holiday cheer.  Santa Who?, starring Leslie Nielson,  has Santa losing his memory and hope at Christmas time, but all turns out well thanks to a young child.  The second movie, A Chance of Snow, about Maddie and Matt Parker, a divorcing couple,  stranded at the airport,  with their children and Maddie's sister, Katherine.  After the Parker's meet the Pulmer's, an older couple who also suffered marital problems, Maddie and Matt look at their marriage differently and reach a decision on what why really want from each other.
summary: Santa who? / A Chance of Snow (Double Feature)
Title: Santa Who? / A Chance of Snow

reviewText: We had recorded Santa Who on a VCR tape years ago from tv. Now we are trying to replace all those movies with DVDs. This one met our expectations entirely and the bonus Chance of Snow movie is a good one too.

Title: Santa Who? / A Chance of Snow

reviewText: Having Leslie Nielsen in "Santa Who" is the reason we got suckered into getting this turkey, and really, I wish he had known that if he needed a job that bad, we would have let him sleep on our couch until he found a decent gig.Santa Who is a made-for-TV movie that gives made-for-TV movies a bad name. It has every trite cliche and every bit of bad writing you can think of. It has children that, if real, would make people everywhere realize that reproducing is evil. Adults that are less than one-dimensional, and stupider than a box of really stupid rocks. Bad pacing, dumb situations... and worst of all, during the time I watched it (before my rising stomach made me turn it off) nothing funny happened! There's nothing good about this movie.Don't waste your money or your time.(I'm ignoring the other movie on the disc, "A Chance of Snow". Proceed at your own risk.)
Title: Santa Who? / A Chance of Snow

reviewText: I gave it five stars even though I believe the ending is different. I had bought it on a VHS which I guess I donated once I got it on a DVD so I cannot be sure, but it seems the VHS movie ended with Jingle Bell Rock, but this movie on DVD doesn't. I miss that because I had never liked that Christmas song until I heard it at the end of the movie. Oh, well. The movie itself is hilarious even though predictable. With Leslie Nielsen playing Saint Nick I don't think you can go wrong. Of course his second-hand man Max also added a lot to the movie. I thought the actors in it carried their parts very well and loved how the child actor portrayed the small boy whose name I forget. He had all the enthusiasm about Christmas most children do at that age. I also watched A Chance of Snow as I happen to like JoBeth Williams but while I am sure I enjoyed it, it was too long ago for me to review it now. I should watch it again at Christmas and add my review of it at that time. I do remember Charles Durning in it whom I enjoyed playing Santa in Mrs. Santa Claus and It Almost Wasn't Christmas so it is bound to be a good movie to watch.
summary: So Nice To Own Santa Who? On A DVD
Title: Santa Who? / A Chance of Snow

reviewText: Great double feature at a fantastic price.  I they are both entertaining and have some great things to think about in life. Highly recommend.
